meanings.definition: A person or thing detested or loathed.
meanings.sent1: To some, spiders are anathema, causing fear and disgust.
meanings.sent2: The bully at school was anathema to the other students, who avoided him at all costs.
meanings.sent3: The idea of eating broccoli was anathema to the picky eater, who preferred only pizza.
meanings.sent4: For the health-conscious individual, fast food is anathema to their diet goals.
meanings.sent5: The criminal's actions were anathema to the peaceful community, leading to his isolation.

meanings.definition: A formal curse by a pope or a council of the Church, excommunicating a person or denouncing a doctrine.
meanings.sent1: The anathema issued by the church caused great fear among the members.
meanings.sent2: The pope's anathema against the heretic was a serious punishment.
meanings.sent3: The anathema on eating meat on Fridays led to creative vegetarian recipes in the community.
meanings.sent4: The anathema of excommunication hung over the sinner's head, urging repentance.
meanings.sent5: The council's anathema on the controversial belief sparked heated debates among the followers.
